ACT
41
Proving a destroyed, lost, hidden or misplaced will
A will destroyed by accident or the action of another person, lost, hidden, or misplaced, before or after the testator's death, but without his knowledge, will produce the effects of a valid will if the interested person proves that the will existed, that it was destroyed, lost, hidden, or misplaced, that it was drawn up in the form prescribed by law and if it proves the content of the part of the will to which it refers.
